config.question: What impact did consumerism have on America?

choices.content: It fostered unity by bringing all Americans into a homogeneous national market.
It created disparity between those in rural and urban areas, based on access to consumer goods.
It led to increasing acts of vandalism by those who could not access the consumer goods market.
It decreased the health and well-being of people and negatively impacted their level of savings.

answer_3.response: Advertising, brand names, chain stores, and mail-order houses brought Americans into a national market. Even as the country grew, a homogeneity of goods bound it together, touching cities and farms, East and West, rich and poor. There was a common language of consumption.
